intro: Villadia thiedei, commonly known as the Thiede's villadia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
